name: Information Warfare
long_desc: In this course, we will examine information warfare through technical as well as strategic, operational, and tactical employment perspectives.  This course will address historical aspects of military deception, electronic warfare, computer network operations, operational security, and psychological operations

custom_fields.goals: Students will understand the interconnectedness of the broader informationecosystem and the ways that competition is currently occurring to advance thegoals of a variety of actors in that sphere.
custom_fields.key_topics:
In this course, we will examine information warfare through technical as well as
strategic, operational, and tactical employment perspectives. This course will
address historical aspects of military deception, electronic warfare, computer
network operations, operational security, and psychological operations.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge:
Advanced technical knowledge equivalent to 15-112, 15-121 or 15-122, and 67-
272.
custom_fields.assessment_structure:
The students will be assessed through hands-on labs and presentations related to
various components of information warfare.
custom_fields.relevance:
University students will learn not just about technical issues related to
information system security, but also broader aspects of how governments and
organizations are utilizing the information realm for competition and advancing
national or organizational goals.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Students will have access to online labs and various readings.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: studying and completion of assigned work.
